meanings.definition: cudgelers: plural noun, people who use cudgels as weapons
meanings.sent1: The cudgelers patrolled the village, ready to defend it from any threats.
meanings.sent2: The group of cudgelers gathered at the town square to discuss their strategy.
meanings.sent3: The cudgelers decided to have a friendly competition to see who could swing their cudgel the farthest.
meanings.sent4: In the ancient tales, the cudgelers were known as the protectors of the kingdom, feared by all enemies.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cudgelers standing guard under the moonlight was etched in the villagers' minds.

meanings.definition: cudgelers: verb, third person present tense of cudgel, to beat with a cudgel
meanings.sent1: He cudgelers the door in frustration, trying to break it open.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith often cudgelers the metal to shape it into tools.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to cudgelers the poor mouse every time it came near.
meanings.sent4: The storm cudgelers the trees, making them sway violently in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The boxer cudgelers his opponent with swift and powerful punches.
